intro: Dentaria hypanica, commonly known as the white toothplant, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, white, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has a basal rosette of narrow, toothed leaves. Its scientific name refers to the tooth-like margins of its leaves and the white color of its flowers. Dentaria hypanica is often found in shaded, well-drained soils and is a valuable plant for pollinators.
